name: Crocosmia
description: Crocosmia is a genus of about 10 species in the family Iridaceae, native to southern and eastern Africa.The plant has sword-shaped foliage and showy, brightly-colored, funnel-shaped flowers on arching stems. Crocosmia will bloom from July to October and attract much attention.
meaning: The scientific name comes from the Greek words “krokos” (“saffron”) and “osme” (“odor” or “smell”), alluding to the saffron scent the dried flowers produce. When the dried flowers are placed in warm water, they emit a strong smell of saffron. Its common name was given in honor of Coquebert de Montbret (1780-1801), a French botanist who accompanied Napoleon when he invaded Egypt in 1798.
color_description: These flowers are usually in shades of red and orange, but can also be yellow.
